Name: SIGLA: Fog & Rain
Description:
SIGLA: Fog & Rain is an abstract card game where players move cards around the table in order to match secret point-scoring patterns in the players’ hands.

To win the game, you must be the first to play all the “Fog & Rain” cards from your hand to the play area in front of you by matching the patterns on the “SIGLA” cards.

—description from the designer

Name: Mammoth
Description:
Players take on the role of mammoth herds by moving around barren tundra and transforming the board from invading brambles and trees to beautiful flora and grasslands. Mammoth is a tile laying game that appeals to ages 8 and up. Players place tiles to grow their specific color of flowers and to increase the size of their path as their mammoth moves through the plains. The game has both competitive and co-operative versions of play.

To begin the game, players place their mammoth to begin a field of colorful flowers. At some point during the game they can also place their other prehistoric mammals to claim a path. Then as they take their turns players place an octagon tile or square tile to increase their color grouping or path.  They can score maximum points placing a tile directly next to their mammoth and growing more color groupings instead of just their own.  The last round starts when the last octagon tile is played. The winner is the player who gained the most points by successfully transforming the barren tundra.

In the co-op version of the game the players work together to accomplish a random color and path goal.  The players play as scientists planning how they are going to guide their mammoths through the park.  Players discuss what actions they want to take and then reveal the available actions for the turn.  Players then choose their actions without discussion and then complete them in turn order.  If the players succeed in accomplishing their goals and reach a required point total before the last octagon tile is placed, the scientists are successful and have transformed the bleak tundra into a beautiful plain.

Name: Pegboard Baseball
Description:
Pegboard Baseball is a two-player themed game based on chance and probability. It is a game of luck and skill. Background knowledge of batter statistics is advantageous. 
The game is handmade by the designer and consists of a 6 inch round piece of wood depicting a baseball diamond with cribbage peg holes around the baselines. Players are represented by team-colored cribbage pegs.

Pegboard Baseball can only be played when watching a baseball game on TV or at the stadium. The main reason you need to be watching a game is because fouls count for one peg movement. The best way to tally foul balls is by watching (or listening to) a game.

The score of the actual baseball game you are watching is not related to the score in Pegboard Baseball.
 The movement of your peg depends entirely on what the batter does at the plate. Any contact between the bat and the ball is awarded by movement of your peg.

How to start:

Choose two pegs that represents your team and the opposing team. Place the two pegs on home plate.

The visiting team will start on the top of home plate (top of the innings) and continue around the bases on that line. The home team will start on the bottom on home plate (bottom of the innings).
 What it looks like
when you are playing:

The person representing the batting team holds the pegboard.
 Choose a goal for your game.  
Possibilities include:

--Follow an entire game and the player with the most points, plus furthest distance, wins.
--Play for an equal number of innings and see whose peg traveled furthest (points plus distance). For example, prior to starting announce, “We are going to play for three innings.”

Peg movement depend on
what each batter does at the plate.

Foul Ball = 1 peg movement
When the batter hits the ball foul, out of play, that equals 1 peg movement.

Inplay Out = 2 peg movements
When a batter hits the ball in fair territory, but the batter is out. This includes pop flies and ground outs.

Single = 3 peg movements
When a batter hits the ball and is safe at 1st base.

Double = 4 peg movements
When the batter hits the ball and is safe at 2nd base. Also, ground rule doubles.

Triple = 5 peg movements
When the batter hits the ball and is safe at 3rd base.

Home run = 6
Two run homer = 12
Three run homer = 18
Grand Slam = 24
 Bunt foul = 2
Bunt infield but out = 4
Bunt single = 6

Optional Scoring

Optional scoring prior to play:

For more peg movement: see directions
For less peg movements: see directions

Optional scoring during play:

Prior to any at-bat (or inning), a player can wager for more or less peg movements based on a hopeful outcome. Experienced fans may know when good players are coming up to bat and decide to risk their peg's movement.
Players are encouraged to be creative in their wagers.

—description from the designer

Name: Army Guys
Description:
Army Guys is a game for people who want to play strategy games, but don't want to sift through a novel to learn the rules or pay thousands of dollars to put together an army.  Army Guys is meant to be played with minimal accessories - you can play on the floor or on a table; you can use literally anything to make up the battlefield; and you only need a tape measure.

—description from the introduction

The game is designed primarily for two opponents but does support more players; the game is intended to be quickly learned and rapidly played.  The rules assume (but do not demand) the game will be played with "little green men" plastic figures, and uses a suitable scale for movement.  Forces are purchased with a point-buy system.  Initial placement uses a "hold and drop" method (preferred) to randomize units in a close area.  Play proceeds in alternating turns.  During each turn a player may select five units and execute two actions with each unit.  The game supports only two actions - move and attack.  Attacking units have an "accuracy" value which must beat the defender's "hitability" value - in which case, hits are automatic.  Damage is randomly rolled.  Several types of special movement and terrain are supported.

—user summary

Name: DropMix: Darren Korb – Flutter Fly (From the Pyre Original Soundtrack) Promo Card
Description:
One of two exclusive promo cards released as giveaways to the attendees of the 2018 Pax East Convention in Boston.

This is an additional wild card (can be played on any color sequence) and plays the song Flutter Fly by Darren Korb. The song was featured in the 2017 Supergiant video game Pyre.

The card features art from the video game.

Icons for the card are as follows:

Yellow (vocals): Horns
Red (Loops): Guitar
Blue (Percussion): Drumbeat
Green (Baseline): Guitar

The expansion icon displays a DM logo in the lower right corner of the card with a "2" below it.

Name: DropMix: G.I. Joe – Main Title Theme (Remix) Promo Card
Description:
One of two exclusive promo cards released as giveaways to the attendees of the 2018 Pax East Convention in Boston.

This is an additional wild card (can be played on any color sequence) and plays a remix of the 1980's G.I. Joe theme song.

Icons for the card are as follows:

Yellow (vocals): Mic
Red (Loops): Keyboard
Blue (Percussion): Drumbeat
Green (Baseline): Keyboard

The expansion icon displays a DM logo in the lower right corner of the card with a "3" below it.

Name: Orodeloro
Description:
Lost in the sea or hidden on the islands, many pirates have left their spoils there. Be smart, plan your route wisely and find their treasures.

Each player has 3 tiles face up in front of them and on his turn must place one of his tile to keep the treasure map going however it must fit with the rest of the tiles already placed.

You gain 1 coin every time you place a tile and then you draw a new tile.

Some tiles have special power:
Treasure chest - allows you to gain 1 extra coin by number of tiles it touches when you place it
Hurricane - allows you to switch between players (you included) as many tiles as your tile touches on the board.
Parrot - allows you to became the captain. The captain can't get attacked and chooses in case of equality at end game who wins.
Fight - allows you to steal from another player (except the captain) as many coins as your tile touches other tiles on the board

If during your turn you can't play one of your tiles, you can discard the last tile and so on by paying 1 coin for each tile you discard.

Game ends when there is no more tiles to draw after playing one. 
The winner is the one with the most gold at the end of the game.

Name: Kirby no Kopitoru!
Description:
A strategic card game featuring Nintendo's Kirby and his friends and rivals, with three different gameplay modes for different audiences and numbers of players. Cute, cheerful artwork and simple rules allowing for good depth and strategic play make it accessible to a wide audience.

"Copy Power Battle" involves choosing Kirby cards from your hand to defeat enemy cards on the table, after which you can gain different copy powers and abilities based on the type of enemies you've defeated. The player with the highest victory points after seven rounds wins, based on the cumulative point value of the enemies they've defeated throughout the game.

"Simple Battle" is a variant on the above gameplay with simplified rules that works better for younger or larger numbers of players.

"Single Battle" is a single-player variant involving a similar gameplay flow to Copy Power Battles, but incorporating waves of enemy cards that must be defeated to see how far you can progress without having your Kirby cards defeated.

Components:
112 Cards (Kirby card ×54, Enemy card ×48, other cards× 10)
Instructions

Name: Peyshoom
Description:
Peyshoom is a Persian implementation of Cards Against Humanity which has a completely new content based on Iranian pop culture.

The game is also the first Iranian game that raised its production costs through crowdfunding with nearly 12000 dollars campaign.

—description from the publisher

Name: Yesss!: Promo cards
Description:
This expansion contains 15 new cards for Yesss!
Add these cards to the base game.

This expansion is given out by the publisher at conventions.

Name: Blood Bowl (2016 Edition): Minotaur
Description:
Minotaurs’ enormous strength, minimal intelligence and vicious, depraved mentality would appear to make them almost perfect Blood Bowl players. Fortunately for most other players however, few coaches allow Minotaurs in their team. This is mainly because of their disconcerting habit of going berserk before, during and after the match and attacking anyone or anything that gets in their way: friends, foes – even the coach!

This multi-part resin kit contains the components you need in order to assemble a Blood Bowl Minotaur. You can field him as a Big Guy for your Chaos, Chaos Dwarf, Chaos Chosen or Chaos Renegades team – he definitely lives up to this, looking both pretty big and pretty chaotic. Densely packed with powerful muscle, the Minotaur is stomping forth with fury, challenging any opposing player to get in the way of his bunched fists and enormous horns. He’s not particularly heavily armoured, but the bits of armour he has strapped on are menacing and spiky, with a delightful skull on the right shoulder; this probably used to belong to someone who didn’t get out of the way quickly enough.

—description from the publisher

'NOTE: An alternate version of the Blood Bowl Minotaur was a limited release in June 2019:'

All minotaurs are slab-muscled and vicious as a rule. On top of all that, some of them carry mutations that make them even more intimidating and lethal, like this cruelly clawed brute. He’s also been fitted with a suitably brutal-looking helmet to protect what’s left of his grey matter. Minotaurs make ideal Blood Bowl players, but few coaches allow them in their team. This is mainly because of their disconcerting habit of going berserk before, during and after the match and attacking anyone or anything that gets in their way – friends, foes or even the coach!

You can field this Minotaur as a Big Guy for your Chaos, Chaos Dwarf, Chaos Chosen or Chaos Renegades team – his enormous mutated claws and sturdy head gear blend well with the look of brutal and corrupted teams. Densely packed with powerful muscle, the Minotaur charges forward to challenge anyone who gets in his way. Well armoured, his kit is fittingly menacing and spiky, with a form-fitting helmet and bulbous eye protectors, as well as a delightful skull on the right shoulder – this probably used to belong to someone who didn’t get out of the way quickly enough.

This kit comes as 6 resin components and is supplied with a 32mm round Blood Bowl base, featuring a slot to place a ball in. Rules for the Minotaur can be found in Death Zone Season Two and the Inaugural Blood Bowl Almanac!

—description from the publisher

Name: Deception: Undercover Allies – Kickstarter Pack
Description:
The Deception: Undercover Allies Kickstarter pack includes one new role card, 13 new clue cards and 10 means cards.

Contains:

Role:
Clever Accomplice

Clues:
Bamboo Steamer
Chopsticks
Clockwork Bird
Dragon Fruit
Fishball
Ghost Mask
Hockey Mask
Instant Noodles
MSG
Necronomicon
Superhero Cape
Superhero Mask
Wineskin

Means:
Airship
Death Ray
Knife Fingered Glove
Laser Shark
Lawnmower
Nailgun
Obsidian Sword
Shotgun
Spear
Z Virus

-description from the publisher's website
Families: Game: Deception – Murder in Hong Kong

Name: Nemesis: TL;DR Version
Description:
This is an asymmetric deck game that was published as a promotion for backers of Nemesis by Awaken Realms.

In this game you wander in a spaceship (10 cards). On your turn you take a card and apply its rules. After that, the next player does the same.

While grabbing eggs or becoming the soldier, you must bluff your way through the spaceship. In this game there are a number of different win conditions.

Name: Quantified
Description:
Quantified is a co-operative board game set in a world in which everyone's behavior is constantly surveilled and analyzed. A player's behavior results in a social credit score, determining their position on the social ladder. Players start from different positions on the social ladder, as refugee, unemployed or employed, with unequal access to human rights. The goal of the game is to make all rights accessible to all players and to fight the implementation of totalitarian policies.

During a typical turn, players can move around the city, add non-player-characters to their network, attempt to solve so-called rally cards (initiatives that support human equality), attempt to prevent so-called threat cards (automatic, constantly approaching negative effects, such as invasive amendments, correction camps or totalitarian laws), or even simply work an official or illegal job. The trick is that not every action can be taken by every player. For example, those without the right to movement take longer to cross the city, while those without the right to free speech can't share their rally cards with others — and even the actions you can take must be taken with care as all actions leak personal data. If too much data is leaked, the players may have to face behavior analysis cards that negatively impact their collective game state!

Ultimately, by solving enough rally cards or working their way up the social ladder, every player should have access to all four human rights. Once this is done, the players win! But if three totalitarian laws come into effect before then or the threat deck runs out, the players collectively lose.

Name: International Soccer Board Game
Description:
ISBG is an action/dexterity-based sports board game that emulates the action, skill and strategy of a conventional soccer match. The board game includes a game board having markings of a conventional soccer pitch. Circular player pieces are utilized to manipulate a ball piece and impart a sliding or a flipping motion in the ball piece. The players may pass, shoot, or to throw the ball in to emulate the play of a conventional soccer match.

Players each control a soccer team that consists of discs representing soccer players. A small disc representing the soccer ball is flicked into the opposing player's goal to score points.

The main mechanic used in ISBG requires players to flick a soccer ball token around the field by pressing the edges of the discs that represent soccer players down on it, thus causing it to move.

The rules of regular soccer a followed when it comes to offsides, corner kicks, etc.

The game is designed to allow for several modes of play.

Name: MLB Fanzy
Description:
Face off in this MLB Fanzy speed dice game featuring all 30 MLB Teams. Flip over a card showing team logos (e.g. AFC East, Teams named after animals, etc) then it is a race to match your dice with what is on the card. Be the first to call out Fanzy and win cards in this fast-paced family game thriller. This game comes with 20 playing cards, 24 dice, and Instructions which have bonus mini games for extended play. It's simple to learn and quick to play!

—description from the publisher

Name: Argute
Description:
Argute is an exciting trick-taking card game. If you like to play cribbage, euchre, hearts, Uno, etc., then this is the new game for you! Many people who have played have commented on how this game works equally well for 2, 3, and 4 or more players. Perfect for inter-generational social events.

The game is intriguingly simple to grasp but allows for unlimited playing experiences.

GOAL The winner is the first to score 6 points or more without being tied with another player. Win points by correctly bidding on the number of tricks you will take.

The ARGUTE card deck is divided into play cards and bid cards. None of the cards have suits. The 42 play cards include 7 cards each of the following denominations: 0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5. The 28 bid cards include 7 sets of cards each of 0, 1, 2, 3.

SET-UP To start each player is given a set of 4 bid cards consisting of a 0, 1, 2 & 3, and will hold onto these cards for the duration. The scorekeeper is chosen and the first dealer will be the oldest person playing the game.

BID PHASE The dealer shuffles the play cards and deals 6 cards face down to each player. Each player looks at their “play” cards and determines how many tricks they will be able to win from zero to three. They then pick the appropriate bid card and place it
FACE DOWN in front of them. Each player only knows their own bid. Once everyone has bid, play begins and no one is allowed to look at any bid cards until the completion of the hand.

GAME PLAY Each 6 card hand is divided into 3 tricks. The first trick consists of 3 cards from every player’s hand. The second trick consists of 2 cards from every player’s hand. The last trick is 1 card from each player.  Each player only plays one card per turn. The player to the dealer’s left leads the first trick. The winner of each trick is the player with the highest total of the cards (ie. Count) played for each separate trick and will lead off the next trick. If two or more players counts are tied, the player who reached the count first wins the trick. (For example, if 4 people are playing and they all play a zero for the last trick (1 card), the player who played the first zero wins the trick.)
At the end of the hand after the three tricks have been won players reveal their bid cards to the table. If a player has correctly bid the number of tricks, she scores that many points. If a player has incorrectly bid the number of tricks he would take, either higher or lower, that player loses one point regardless of his bid. If a player bids zero and gets zero tricks, she neither loses nor gains any points, her score stays the same for that hand.
The deal moves to the left. If two or more players are tied with six or more points at the end of a hand, all players play another hand until only one player leads with six or more.

—description from the publisher

Name: Horus Heresy: Sedition's Gate Booster
Description: 120 additional cards for the base game.

Name: Istanbul: The Dice Game – Die Moschee-Erweiterung
Description:
Available at conventions

Postcard-sized expansion with 2 tiles printed on the card that can be used instead of buying a tile from the selection on the table.

- spend 2 brown joker tiles: You get 6 Lira, 1 crystal, and 1 bonus card.

- spend 4 crystals to take 1 ruby from anywhere on the board.

Place 1 of the spent resources on the tile which was used. This tile can't be used again during this game.

Those tiles do not count for having 4/5 bought tiles.

Name: Pony Pix
Description:
There are 12 horse photograph cards to complete. Players throw the dice to collect parts of each image and aim to piece together as many horses as possible.

On their turn, a player rolls both dice. If doubles are rolled, the player gets another turn. To start a pony, a 1 must be rolled. Pieces must be collected in sequential order (pieces are labeled 1 thru 6) and multiple puzzles may be worked on simultaneously. A player may also sum the two dice to take a puzzle piece if it's the next one they need.

Players can also steal the #1 horse part from each other if they roll a 1 and no more are available from the center of the table. However, they must take it from the player with the most ponies and only of that pony hasn't been completed up to the fourth piece. When this happens, the player who had their piece stolen must return the remaining pieces of that pony to the center.

Play continues until the last pony is completed. The player with the most horses wins the game.

Name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – The Hunt
Description:
The Hunt is the first expansion aka thematic pack for Serengeti: A Race For Life. It contains 30 cards and provides an alternative to the starting setup as well as changing the dynamics of the game.

In The Hunt the emphasis is on predators, a class of animals found in the game that is further expanded in this expansion with the addition of the Cheetah, boosted by the inclusion of a secondary scavenger, the Vulture.

The Vulture takes center stage in this thematic pack and is required in every game playing with this setup while the Cheetah can be added to any setup provided by the base game or other thematic packs.

—description from the publisher

Name: Serengeti: A Race For Life – Migration
Description:
Migration is the second expansion aka thematic pack for Serengeti: A Race For Life. It contains 30 cards and provides an alternative to the starting setup as well as changing the dynamics of the game.

In Migration the emphasis is on grassing animals, a class of animals found in the game that is further expanded in this expansion with the addition of the Zebra.

The Zebra takes center stage in this thematic pack and is required in every game playing with this setup, alongside the Wildebeests (special cards) that drives a new majority that players will need to vie for.

Of course no Great Migration would be complete without Crocodile watching their every move, so expect a game of attrition where our grass-eating friends can roam free, but not as freely as they'd wish!

—description from the publisher

Name: Grim Peak
Description:
Grim Peak is a fantasy combat game set upon an arena atop a peak. Players are tasked with both surviving their time on the peak and working together to destroy a variety of enemies summoned into the arena with them, some of which, may affect other monsters in the arena, creating new, dangerous threats.

The game becomes more challenging as ever more monsters are summoned into the arena with players. Players must then use their combat abilities, magical powers, or both, to not only destroy monsters, but also distract and slow their progress.

Grim Peak is won if players defeat all monsters while allowing themselves to be defeated in combat only a very limited number of times.

Name: Army of Darkness: The Board Game
Description:
Army of Darkness: The Board Game is a co-operative game for 1 to 4 players that can be played in 60 to 90 minutes. In this action-assignment area-control game, you play as Ash and his allies, and work together to fight off swarms of Deadites commanded by Evil Ash and Evil Shiela. Upgrade your defenses with modern technology from the trunk of Ash's car, and stop the Deadites from overtaking the castle. Each turn, players have a limited time to simultaneously play move, attack, action, and special cards in order to defend the various sections of the castle. After time is up, resolve your chosen cards and play out your programmed actions, rolling dice to attack Deadites. Survive long enough to use the necronomicon to save Shiela, and take down Evil Ash to win the game!

—description from publisher
Families: Movies: Evil Dead / Army of Darkness

Name: Rampaging Jotunn: Reverse Deck
Description:
Rampaging Jotunn: Reverse Deck is an alternative to the deck of cards in the original game!

It has 74 cards that reverse all the movements and turns on the previous cards. For example, if the original card said 2 Turn two Facings Forward 2 Movement Points the Reverse Deck card says Forward 2 Movement Points Turn 2 Facings. This offers a fresh and challenging way to play Rampaging Jotunn!

The Reverse Deck also features the Rampage Card which allows the Jotunn to move on its own!

Note: Rampaging Jotunn is required to use these cards.

Name: Team Yankee: Hammerfall – World War III Battles
Description:
Hammerfall is an introduction to the world of Team Yankee, the World War III miniatures game.

Team Yankee is a tabletop miniatures wargame that is set in a fictional World War III in 1985 based on the novel of the same name by Harold Coyle.

The game is a standard two player miniature wargame with each player taking command of a company or battalion level force consisting of hand painted miniatures. The game provides one 6 different missions for the purpose of pickup games. There are also several scenarios in the book that allow the players to recreate some of the battles from the Team Yankee novel.

The game has an accompanying line of 15mm scale miniatures to use but it can be played with models from any manufacture.

Name: AESQ
Description:
AESQ is a 4X board game that relies on deckbuilding mechanics. It is set in the Eastern Mediterranian during the Iron Age, in which all myths and believes of the time, like faeries, demons, witches and sorcerers, heroes and deities, are actual.

The game is for 1 to 5 players with 5 starting factions. Each player begins with a core deck that upgrades by acquiring unit and action cards, deploys armies and expands their territory by exploration and conquest.

Name: Run Nibbles Run
Description:
Run Nibbles Run is a fast pace reaction game for party, by flipping game cards, following tasks specified in cards , making funny faces, building blocks, sending nibbles back to home, or playing hide and seek, all must be done within one minute.

1. First put all the game components on table, starts from youngest player, initially clockwise.

2. Everyone shouts: Run Nibbles Run, and put the sandtimer upside down start the game round.

3. Flip over top card drom draw pile, complete task on each card, for task been done, you get the card.

4. After finish one card, rapidly flip over another card, try to collect more cards within one minute.

5. The player who gets most nuts on cards is the winner.

—description from the designer

Name: Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago – Gods of Fire
Description: In the shifting labyrinth of the Ghost Archipelago, there is one group of islands that can almost always be found; the Islands of Fire. Surrounded by a grey haze of sooty smoke, the islands contain numerous active volcanoes. Despite the constant threat of annihilation, many tribal groups call these islands home, building their villages on the rocky slopes or in the black jungles of gnarled and stunted trees that surround the mountains. In this supplement for Frostgrave: Ghost Archipelago, the Heritors lead their crew to these blighted isles in search of clues to the location of the Crystal Pool. Containing a host of new scenarios, crewmen types, creatures, and treasure, this volume also includes guidelines for building unique tribes to use as adversaries in scenarios or as allies to the Heritors in their quest.

Name: Frostgrave: The Wizard's Conclave
Description:
In this new supplement for Frostgrave, some of the biggest names in gaming turn their creative powers towards the Frozen City, each contributing a scenario and adding their own flair to the game. Featuring scenarios by Alessio Cavatore, Alex Buchel, Andy Chambers, Gav Thorpe, Chris Pramas, Daniel Mersey, Andrea Sfiligoi, and many more, this tome provides a collection of adventures that will pit players against unimaginable foes and challenges, pushing their wizards and warbands to new limits.

Wizards tend to be solitary, keeping to themselves and associating with a select few apprentices, followers, and henchmen. It is rare that they spend time in the company of other spellcasters, and rarer still that they work together. Now, however, something is about to take place that has not occurred since the great days of Felstad -- a gathering of wizards.

Name: Postcard DUNGEONS CO-OP
Description: This additional new card includes another diabolical dungeon, treasures, and rules changes for playing the game together cooperatively to defeat the DARK LORD, an evil presence invading from a neighboring postcard.

Name: Postcard Dungeons: Player's Compendium
Description: The Compendium expansion will add the option for each player to choose a favored fantasy race or profession that will influence their adventures!

Name: Postcard Dungeons: MEGADUNGEON
Description: The Postcard Megadungeon. Your adventurers will have a new and deadly underground labyrinth within which to seek out glory and treasure.

Name: Time of Legends: Joan of Arc – Legendary Dragon
Description: The Legendary Dragon is the biggest figure in the game and the biggest playable figure in boardgame history. And it's not just there to decorate your shelf, it is a playable figurine, which brings new rules and new game sensations. This extension adds new models, a new game play, new hexagons to give you even more play time and fun, and a new special scenario.
Families: Game: Time of Legends – Joan of Arc

Name: The Hollow Earth
Description:
The Hollow Earth is a tabletop skirmish game set in the Victorian era. With hints of Lovecraft the game sees gangs fighting over territory and attempting to take control of the trade routes established since the breach into the Hollow Earth.

—description from the publisher

Name: Perdition's Mouth: Abyssal Rift – The Sabotage
Description:
Descending lower into the dungeon, Neshilim and Raven noticed that a faint buzzing sound, which could be heard near the stairs going down, had suddenly stopped. Below them an even blacker darkness than normal greeted them...

This is a Hard scenario which adds a clever timer mechanic and multiple objectives. Thanks to the timer the pressure is on in this scenario. Can you save the Victims in time and make it out alive yourself?

This scenario was first released as a pdf promo to raise funds for the Uganda Gamechangers project.

Name: Dorasure: Yggdrasil
Description:
GIANTHOBBY original board game "DORASURE" Enhanced version 8th!

Yggdrasil, a super-technical research institute, can also be said to go one hundred years ahead of the world.
A new character belonging to Yggdrasil will join the adventure.
"DORASURE" is a fully cooperative miniature board game.

This set is a set for "DORASURE" expansion. "DORASURE" main body is necessary for play.

Name: Oiligopoly
Description:
Oiligopoly tries to parallel as much as possible the real world oil industry while at the same time trying to keep the game simple and interesting. For example, a player must find crude-oil, refine it into gasoline, and then sell the gasoline. This is done by landing on an oil well property to collect a round crude-oil chip, taking the round chip to a refinery property where it is exchanged for a square gasoline chip, and and taking the square chip to a gas station property where it is sold to the bank.
—description from the instruction manual

Oiligopoly uses Monopoly-style concepts to simulate the oil industry, while adding some unique play elements which help it work with the theme. 
—user summary

Name: Giant Giggly Winks
Description:
A twist on Tiddlywinks. The 'board' is a vinyl mat on a grand scale. It shows flowers with petals. Players have a launcher each which is spring-loaded. The flip their counters on to the board. The first to get all their counters on to the flowers, wins.
The box illustrates a game in play.

—user summary

Name: Fetch Quest
Description:
Fetch Quest is a family-friendly cooperative deck-building game. Each player represents a pioneer, one of six adventurous dogs on a dangerous quest. The pioneers work together to overcome dangerous challenges and resolve missions. Once the missions are resolved, the quest is finished and the players win the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Absolutism
Description:
Absolutism is a party card game that presents players with unfathomable scenarios of daily life in a totalitarian society to which they have to offer solutions. But as no sane solutions can save you in a real dictatorship, in Absolutism.

The game offers a funny satirical take on dictatorship from a team of three who spent their childhood and adolescence in… communism.

We strongly believe that humor is healing. Some people who lived in Dictatorships still have a good amount of healing left to do. And some other people who just now make contact with some sort of pre-dictatorship reality will definitely need this humorous approach to survive and overcome it. We hope to provide some of that humor to them with the ABSOLUTISM game.

With a unique blend of descriptive language and political themes, Absolutism gives a deep understanding of a totalitarian way-of-life while having crazy fun.

—description from the publisher

Name: Darling in the Franxx: Training Grounds
Description:
Based on the hit anime by Studio Trigger, Training Grounds is an unique 2 v 2 free print and play board game where you and your partner straddle on to pilot a Franxx together in order to defeat your opponents who do the same in combat training.

Each pair consists of 1 Stamen and 1 Pistil player. Pick your character respectively and partner up to co-pilot in a fun simultaneous select and reveal action programming system.

You'll want to communicate with your partner so your attack is well coordinated, but the more you communicate, the more info you give away to your opponents!

Download the Print and Play here: https://www.brotherminggames.com/
Play the Table Top Simulator here: https://steamcommunity.com/workshop/filedetails/?id=1367936675

Name: Arkham Horror: The Card Game – The City of Archives: Mythos Pack
Description:
The City of Archives is the fourth Mythos Pack in The Forgotten Age cycle for Arkham Horror: The Card Game.

Following the events of Heart of the Elders, you and your team of investigators have journeyed deep into a series of caverns where a new world lays hidden from the outside world. Strange creatures that cannot be of this world have seemingly lived beneath the shell of the Earth for centuries. They are horrifying to look upon, but are they dangerous? Now within their domain, it may be best to go along with whatever they want, but how much can you trust them, and what might your naïveté cost you?

This Mythos Pack features a new mechanism that makes playing this scenario an out-of-body experience, as well as new player cards to customize your investigators' decks.

—description from the publisher
Families: Collectible: Living Card Game (Fantasy Flight Games)
Game: Arkham Horror – The Card Game
Game: Arkham Horror TCG – The Forgotten Age
Series: Arkham Horror Files (Fantasy Flight Games)

Name: Cruce de los Andes, Vol. 1: Gobernación
Description:
Cruce de los Andes is a set of two games about the Argentinian independence leader José de San Martín. The first volume, "Government" tells the story of San Martín's ruling of freshly independent Argentina in the 1810s and his preparations for crossing the Andes in search for the liberation of Chile (which is scheduled to be covered in the second part of the series). 
The game consists mostly of cards containing historical characters or events, and players cooperatively strive to collect sets of 8 cards each (in ascending order) of equipment, troops, politics and history, and the more they manage to put on the table in the correct order, the better they score.

The box also contains two micro role playing games by Benjamín Anibal Reyna and Martín Bravo.
Families: History: Latin American Wars of Independence

Name: Can You Handle It? Life With Kids
Description:
Can You Handle It? Life with Kids is a stress management game. The higher your stress, the higher your score. The winner is the parent with the lowest stress points at the end of the game. Event cards present stressful situations that you must either overcome or accept. You can also play Event cards against other parents. Don't go out there all alone - use cards from your hand to help you lower your stress points. Equip Items to use throughout the game to help block stress from Events. Or you can use De-Stressors to lower your overall stress score. Once the deck has been played through, the Parent with the lowest stress score wins. But really, does any Parent ever truly win?

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Gang War III
Description: Necromunda: Gang War III introduces House Van Saar; the technological powerhouse of Necromunda, creators of the finest weapons and armour of all Houses, whose power is built around a dark secret. Along with this, the book introduces Brutes – a new type of hanger-on – and rules for expanding the role of the Arbitrator in your games of Turf War.

Name: Taifa: Intriga y guerra en la Hispania Medieval
Description:
Taifa is a card driven board game set in medieval Spain in the 11th century, where each player controls one of the main kingdoms of the time, which can be Christian or Muslim.

A game has 4 turns and lasts about 2 hours. Each turn players receive a variable number of cards, which can be historical events, troops or response cards, and they play them in alternate rounds until all pass or run out of cards.

The cards are divided into two decks, one for the Christian kingdoms, and one for the Muslims “Taifas”, and each deck has a different style of play. The whole game revolves around the cards, there is no economy or armies on the map, it is a fast game with the complexity level of a eurogame, but at the same time with a lot of historical flavor.

At the beginning of the game all players start with the same number of controlled areas, and at the end the one who controls more areas than the others wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Pricetitution
Description:
Pricetitution is a card game where you guess how much money it would take your friends to do absurd things. Then you can pointlessly argue and reexamine your friendships. Lovingly, of course.

Made from conversations you already have. Each round, guess how much money it would take one player, "The Pricetitute," to do what a card says. Closest guess wins. High fives and arguing follow.

—description from the designer

Name: Swordcrafters Expanded Edition
Description:
Swordcrafters Expanded Edition includes the Swordcrafters base game and expands on the game with three exciting new modules that can be played singly or combined. The sword of protection has broken again. The king has opened up the forgotten tomb granting you access to Sword Mastery, Sword Relics, and Sword Tips.

In Swordcrafters, players compete to forge the best sword scoring based on length, quality, and magic. Each round, each player makes one cut in a grid of sword tiles to create a separation. After the separations phase, each player selects one grouping of sword tiles and assembles them into their sword. When there are not enough sword tiles to form a new grid, scoring occurs.

Players hold their swords in the center of the table to score based on length. Sword quality is based on the highest number of adjacent matching gems on each side of the sword. Sword magic scoring is based on the relevant gems required by each of three sword magic cards.

The Expanded Edition layers in three exciting new modules: Relics, Tips, and Mastery. Relics add new tiles to the grid creating more importance on your set collection expertise. Tips grant players two additional goals that score based on their sword. Mastery challenges players to complete mini-goals throughout the game.

The enemies are growing stronger and the King has asked you to craft an enhanced sword of protection using:
- Sword Mastery: claim each round to hone your blade
- Sword Relics: Add fragments of the past to the grid to keep your slices and selections intense
- Sword Tips: personal goals test how sharp you truly are
Contents include the full base game plus three modules to mix and match for amazing replay value:

Name: Robotech: Crisis Point
Description:
Following the annihilation of Earth, human survivors struggle to rebuild their once-great planet, only to be faced with a new threat. The Robotech Masters arrive to complete the mission that their Zentraedi armada began... to secure their empire by reclaiming the Protoculture matrix before it is located by the Invid. In their way stands the Army of the Southern Cross!

The exciting, stand-alone sequel to SolarFlare Games’ ROBOTECH: Force of Arms lets you take control of the epic conflict known as the Second Robotech War. One player takes the lead as the plotting, scheming, desperate Robotech Masters, while the other player commands the valiant and determined Army of the Southern Cross.

In this head-to-head card game, players are engaged in conflict for control of the Earth, each side pitting their varied infantry and mecha-based units against each other in an all-out war with only one victor. In addition to their mecha and weapons, players wield powerful command actions and amazing heroes to turn the tide of conflict and ensure victory.

ROBOTECH: Crisis Point is a two-player head-to-head card game. Strategy, tactics, area control, bluffing, and hand management all come into play in this dynamic and deep game of Alien vs Human in a battle of wits and courage. Will you save humanity or utterly destroy it?

+  + + +

Robotech: Crisis Point is a strategic game of unit movement and area control in which you take on the role of either the Army of the Southern Cross (AoSC) or the dreaded Robotech Masters. You and your opponent maneuver your units trying to defeat the enemy's forces. Using heroes and distinctive commands at the right time can turn the tide of the battle in your favor. Are you ready to defend Earth as the courageous Army of the Southern Cross or capture the flower of life as the Robotech Masters?

In more detail, players try to destroy their opponent's units while also successfully defending their own forces. Players take turns tactically deploying units, strategically placing their combat and support units to defend their own forces and destroy those of their enemy, while using their hero and command cards to win the day.

Once the players have finished the tactical, token, and command/hero phases, they tally up the victory points for the units and strategic locations successfully defended. They then add the victory points for the enemy units they were able to successfully destroy. The player with the most points wins!

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Sewer Fever
Description:
Sewer Fever is a whole new expansion which will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the included Campaign Chapter, your heroes will be able to go under Castelray, the royal capital of Istarra and explore its repulsive sewers, infested with rats. They are humanoid rodents,that live in smelly tunnels and look to devour every intruder they can find.

By living underground, rats are also filled with diseases. They are almost immune to their own germs - even if they don´t live long enough to get old – but infect whoever gets too close, which usually gives them a certain advantage. Disease reduces the attack and physical ability of those wishing to confront them.

The sewers are also filled with traps that can quickly neutralize intruders (or food). Event cards will make the place more dangerous, by making swarms of little rats show up or by making your heroes fall in deadly traps. There's still a positive side to all of this, though. With all the waste that is thrown in the sewers, some good surprises may sometimes be found.

—description from the publisher

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Death Crypt
Description:
Death Crypt is a new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With this Campaign Chapter, your heroes will find some good old orc pleasure: crossing the dark corridors of evil dungeons and crypts, haunted by revenants hungry for fresh meat and looking for new souls to join their ranks. There might even be some evil necromancer that possesses the key to a well kept treasure! It all depends whether you are there to smash some skulls or to bring back some treasures.

Revenants are not guided by the same principles as the living. There is no Alert level, nor Patrols. However, if an undead notices a possible prey he will attract others like him, and if you let the undead ranks grow, you will end up overwhelmed. During the Patrol phase, each tomb over the tiles where heroes are can generate undead. And at that point, it's pointless to try to hide… the fresh odour of fresh meat will attract them, wherever you may be.

At the heart of the gloomy crypts, many morbid events may arise. Be careful where you set your feet, spectral hands may get you and hinder your movement. If there's a Necromancer around, his maleficent spells can create several fatal situations. When it's time to draw from the Event cards, your fingers might end up shaking a lot…

—description from the publisher

Name: どうぶつトレカ (Animal Trading Card)
Description:
ã©ã†ã¶ã¤ãƒˆãƒ¬ã‚« (Animal Trading Card) is a two player card game with light easy rules. The players are battling each other using decks of cards with animals. One player has daytime animals, the other has nocturnal animals (some animals are both). Each player has seven stars. The first to take the seventh star off their opponent is the winner (you can vary this to make the game shorter).

The game is deliberately designed to be easy for new gamers to play a trading-card style game (like Magic: the Gathering) by learning deck-building. The theme, artwork and gameplay make this an easy introduction into deck building and combative style TCGs. But there is no actual trading involved. The game includes all the cards you need.

Each player's deck has various animals, from large and strong to small and weak. Each animal needs food and players collect enough food to be able to send the animal of their choice into combat on the player mat. Animals have values for strength and heart, the animal with stronger or equal values defeats the other. But food is consumed as they attack, and if the player exhausts their food supply, they lose.
-user summary

The publisher says "Easy to play! Easy to start!". They say the game is for children and adults who would not normally try a TCG-style game like this. The simple illustrations and easy rules make it a good introduction. The game has 80 cards, 2 play sheets and 1 instruction sheet in Japanese. There is some Japanese text on the cards.

Name: 90 Min
Description:
90 min is a realistic football (soccer) simulation board game, designed not only for football fans.

Taking turns, the players move their pawns across the field in order to score a goal. Every turn represents 1 (advanced) or 2 (standard) min in the match. The players use a minutes track to monitor the progress of the match and after 90 min the game is over.

Different types of players and the fan support will influence the odds. Tackling, free kick, corner kick, throw-in and offside: 90 min implements almost every aspect of a real match with simple rules.

Tackling is resolved by duel cards: Each player has the same set of cards ranging from 1-10. To resolve a tackling they simultaneously chose a card and the higher card wins, but if the difference is too high, a foul happens, making each tackling an exciting duel.

A set of advanced rules and tactic cards can be used to add even more details of a real football match.

-description from publisher

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Chapter Box – Royal Mines
Description:
The Royal Mines is a brand new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. With the Campaign Chapter included, your heroes will be able to infiltrate the dwarf mines, at the borders of the Kingdom of Istarra, and get precious artifacts. But be careful, the expedition will not be easy, and our heroes risk losing some blood there.

The dwarves are a hard-working, meticulous and greedy people. They never stop digging galleries to exploit as many deposits as possible, to trade what they extract from them or to create the best crafts in the world. It is in one of these mines, northeast of the border of the kingdom, called the Royal Mine of Skatten, that legends tell a powerful weapon is hidden.

The mines are heavily guarded. Patrols circulate regularly, because dwarves can never be careful enough. The alert level can rise very quickly, and the mission can fail at the slightest mistake. The mines are real labyrinths where it is easy to get lost. The access is forbidden to slowpokes and it will be important to be like the dwarves: methodical and effective.

—description from the publisher

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Quests Box – PorkQuest
Description:
PorkQuest is a new expansion that will enrich the OrcQuest universe with new enemies. Here, the Porks have a mission to come chase your heroes during their adventures. Secret poachers have hired these ignoble beings to track down and kill any orc infiltrating the Kingdom of Istarra. So you can add porks as additional enemies in any chapter of the Main Campaign. You will also have the choice of playing them as heroes, allying with the orcs, and you risk seeing them kill each other at the slightest misunderstanding.

As enemies of orcs, the Porks have a mission to hunt down and kill any green skin they encounter. The Pork Trackers will have their own Patrols instead of the normal Patrols. Except that here, the Porks "feel" the presence of orcs, thanks to their highly developed sense of smell. They will go directly to the heroes to try and exterminate them.

In addition, Pork Trackers are not the only ones who resent greenskins. Three Pork bounty hunters prowl the area and may arrive at any time to do carnage, even if it means slaughtering everyone between them and their target.

The Porks can also be used as heroes alongside the orcs and as a band of adventurers who have sworn to help the greenskins in their quest, provided they leave them the found treasures.

—description from the publisher

Name: OrcQuest WarPath: Quests Box – Wings & Claws
Description:
Wings and Claws is a new expansion that will enrich the Orcquest universe with new enemies. With the included side Quests, your heroes will be able to measure forces with two daunting monsters that will build up to some intense, epic fights.

Gather at the depths of the sewers, where no living creature or spirit dares to go. Our heroes have heard of the Tarasque, a giant aberration of nature. They almost ask themselves how she got there.

Another epic battle will be waiting for you in the cemetery of Castelray, where you will be facing a very particular kind of greenskin. Brawls between greenskins happen more often than one would think of, and this is not surprising because for orcs fighting is a rewarding experience. And sometimes, to try and convince some of them, you must first challenge them...

—description from the publisher

Name: Monstrite
Description:
They are strong, quick, intelligent and tireless. The monsters are the latest technological discovery and the most popular item on the market. Just a few days after release, they are already being used in many areas, from industrial production to show business.

However, you — the scientists of the monster factory — have a terrible secret: You wish to use the monsters you have created to help you conquer the world! You are just biding your time while the public becomes used to them, then you will call them back and spread panic! You should train your monsters in the arena to learn special tricks to use in the final battle. Sounds easy? It might be, but you must watch out for your colleagues who have the same evil plan as you. You will have to fight them first if you want to win and rule the world!

Monstrite is divided into two game phases. During the first phase, players amass monstrite tokens and by using the machine cards they create monster tokens. During this phase, players earn victory points (VPs) by selling monsters based on the contract cards.

In the second phase, they call the monsters back and fight each other in order to become the undisputed leader. During this phase, player earn VPs by battling with their monsters and winning battle cards. Battles are solved by using a special bidding system and by the utilization of trick cards. At the end of the game, the player with the most VPs wins!

•••

Sono forti, agili, intelligenti e instancabili. I mostri sono una grande scoperta tecnologica e il miglior prodotto sul mercato. È passato poco tempo dal loro lancio in commercio, ma sono già utilizzati in molti settori; dalla produzione in fabbrica al mondo dello spettacolo. Ma non è tutto oro quel che luccica. Tutti voi creatori di mostri nascondete un terribile piano; volete usare i mostri per conquistare il mondo. Sarà sufficiente aspettare che la gente si sia abituata alla loro presenza per iniziare a seminare il panico. Nel frattempo potrebbe essere utile allenare segretamente i mostri facendoli combattere nell’arena, così che possano apprendere nuove tecniche di combattimento per la battaglia finale. Sembra facile? Potrebbe esserlo. Ma meglio ricordare che anche altri scienziati hanno lo stesso obiettivo. Solo chi vincerà la battaglia finale avrà il mondo in pugno. 
Gestisci la fabbrica, diffondi i mostri ovunque nel mondo e, una volta che sarà iniziata la guerra, sconfiggi i tuoi avversari in una battaglia “all’ultimo mostro”!

Monstrite si divide in due fasi di gioco. 
Durante la prima fase i giocatori devono accumulano i gettoni Monstrite e utilizzarli per costruire mostri sempre più evoluti, grazie all’ausilio delle carte Macchina. Inoltre, in questa fase si ottengono punti vittoria vendendo i Mostri, in accordo alle carte Contratto, a settori diversi, come quello industriale, quello dello spettacolo o l’arena. 
Durante la seconda fase i giocatori richiamano i mostri sinora creati e li utilizzano per scontrarsi allo scopo ottenere il dominio incontrastato. In questa fase si ottengono punti vincendo le carte Battalgia contro gli altri giocatori, grazie a un meccanismo di aste e all’ausilio di carte Trucchetto. 
Alla fine del gioco, vincerà il giocatore che avrà conquistato il maggior numero di punti vittoria.

Name: 'Nam
Description: 'Nam is a Vietnam War Tactical level miniatures wargame, based on Battlefront's Team Yankee ruleset, designed for larger scale battles and offensives between 1965 and 1972.
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: Outremer: Faith and Blood
Description: Outremer: Faith and Blood is a 28mm skirmish wargame featuring small groups of warriors fighting in Outremer during the Crusades. While suitable for one-off skirmish encounters the focus of the game is a structured and progressive campaign setting in which they are able to watch their force grow and develop over a series of scenarios and encounters from a small party of five or so soldiers into a powerful warband a score strong. Character development is key, and a wide range of troop options and factions allows a high degree of individuality and personalisation. Players will also be able to recruit mercenaries and agents such as Hashashin and Varangian survivors to bolster their forces - potent but expensive additions that will add a distinct flavour to each encounter.

Name: Across A Deadly Field: The War in the East
Description:
The War in the East, a supplement for John Hill's Across a Deadly Field, gives players the resources to recreate the battles, great and small, of the Eastern Theater of the Civil War.
Step into the shoes of Robert E. Lee and drive towards Washington with the Army of Northern Virginia, or take command of the Army of the Potomac, and attempt to capture Richmond.
With scenarios, including an optional mini-campaign for the first day of Gettysburg, and special rules that enhance gameplay, this volume offers players, whether Union or Confederate, a versatility that can accommodate their preferences and miniatures collections without sacrificing either playability or historical accuracy.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Follyfoot Save a Pony Game
Description: A roll and move game based on the Follyfoot TV series and licensed to Whitman publishing by ITV. Players circuit a board making payments and occassionally compete in the gymkana subgame in the centre of the board.

Name: Monster Fight
Description:
Who would win in a fight, a zombie or an alien? A giant Kraken or a fire-breathing dinosaur? A robot or a mad scientist? Now it's your chance to find out with a new card game from  Alternate Histories.

The way you play Monster Fight is simple, and it’s fun for the whole family, ages six and up, with fun illustrations by everyday balloons.

There are five kinds of monsters: Zombies, Robots, Aliens, Kraken, and fire-breathing Dinosaurs. Each one is assigned a number based on their strength. There are also five colors (or zones for colorblind). Each player gets 8 cards. The first player must play a card that “beats” that monster in a fight, either by playing the next number in the sequence (1, 2, 3, 4, 5 and then repeat) or by playing any monster with the same color. There are also a lot of special action cards, like a Mad Scientist card that creates any monster you want, cloning machines that make other players draw a card, and even a doomsday device card that causes everyone to pass their cards to the left.

The first player to get rid of all their cards, wins!

-description from designer

Name: Drop Racers
Description:
You are a Drop Racer. Your goal is to be the best racer in the land and get the Great Drop Trophy. But this isn't any normal race. Instead of who can go the fastest or farthest, you are trying to be the first one to earn enough points. To earn points, you must collect special Drops that litter the race track while avoiding the Black Drops. Collect the right Drops, score points, win the trophy. Welcome to Drop Racers.

Drop Racers is a fast, family-friendly game about flicking and nudging small cars around the table and trying to bump into different colored drops. Each player is trying to use the drops they've bumped into to score cards in their hand. The first player to score 15 points worth of cards wins the game.

-description from publisher
______________

This game was one of the 4 finalists in the 2016 Mayday Games Design Contest held at Geekway to the West (game convention). Thanks to all the folks at Geekway, the judges, and Mayday Games for giving us the chance to create and show off our game.

Name: Rumini: Kincsesláda
Description:
Uniqe tactical card game with three different versions for youngsters and adults!

Your goal in the game is to compile the most valuable collection of treasures in your treasure chest, gaining the most points. You can collect most points if you have a card in your treasure chest, that no one else has, not even the Bank or if you collect many of the same type of cards, and the Bank also has many of them.

The game includes:
5 types of treasure cards, each with 3 categories, slightly different from one another
3 types of markers:
Red marker: you have to throw out cards permanently
Green marker: you give the card to the Bank
Boat marker: you make the card part of your treasure chest

Game overview:
In the beginning of the game the card pile is divided equally between the players. The first player turn their top card face up and put down without looking at it. As soon as the card is shown anyone can put one of their markers on the card. One card can only have one marker. The round is over when all the players showed the defined number of cards (for example 3 players show 4 cards per person in a round). Cards without markers are used again in the last round, the marked cards are placed according to their marking. The game is over when all the cards are played out.

Scoring:
If you have a card that is not in the Bank, but more than one player has it, is worth 1 point per card. 
If you have a card that is also can be found in the Bank, the card will be worth as many points as the number of cards in the Bank.
If you have a card that is not in the Bank, and only one player has it, is worth 10 points.

—description from the designer

Name: Dragon Ball Z Power Up! Board Game
Description:
Join the Z fighters as you compete to defeat the dragon and become the next champion in Dragon Ball Z Power Up! Board Game.

Each player starts with a unique line-up of characters that they are trying to score the most points with. Players take turns moving any character up the board until a character gets to the top. Once a character is advanced to the top board, players vote to see whether the character stays or is kicked off the board. It takes only one NO vote to get them off the board — but players should use their NO votes wisely as each player has only two NO votes in their hand. The round ends when the character is unanimously voted to stay at the top.

Score up your points and play another round. Game ends after three rounds.

—description from the publisher

Name: Brian Clough's Football Fortunes
Description:
Brian Clough's Football Fortunes is a football management game with a big difference. In an exciting departure from earlier computer simulation games, Brian Clough's Football Fortunes combines an excellent range of computer based features with a fascinating board game. The result for the players is a package which gives the social aspects and skill of other best-selling board game with the flexibility and speed of play which only a computer can supply. Brian Clough's Football Fortunes can be played by two to five players who take on the role of team managers. Each manager must successfully steer his team through the season, using his skill to make his team stronger as the game proceeds. He competes with human and computer controlled teams in a ten strong league, and the F.A. Cup. From the second season onwards, each team will also enter one of three European competitions. Features Include:

     Ten strong league
     FA and European Cups
     4 skill levels
     Variable game length
     Computer die
     Teleprinter
     Constantly updated league tables and assessments of each managers performance.


—description from the publisher

Name: Get the Shinies
Description:
Players take on the role of adventurers and race to gather mysterious creatures in this otherworldly safari.

The cards:
• Adventure cards provide step-by-step instructions to setup and play through each round.
• Shinies are the gemmed bugs that players try to capture during adventures.
• Catchies represent the items and methods used to capture shinies.
• Missions are the assignments given to players during the game to be completed for bounties.  (Requirement varies.)
• Bounties award/ represent treasure, the currency used to determine the winner.  (Reward amount varies.)

Setup:
• Players start by separating the cards into five draw stacks by type (adventures, shinies, catchies, missions, and bounties).
• Each player draws 5 catchies to form their hand.
• Each player draws 1 mission to complete.
That's it, you're ready to play!

Gameplay:
Get the shinies is broken down into a series of rounds known as "adventures".

• Before each round players replenish their hand of catchies, as necessary (up to the maximum of five).
• At the beginning of each round an adventure card is placed into the center of the play area to guide players through the setup and gameplay of each round.
• Players then take alternating turns matching their catchies with shinies to capture them as directed by the adventure card until the round is over.
• At the end of each round players check to see if they've captured enough shinies to complete their mission.  If enough shinies have been captured the player: exchanges the required number of shinies for a bounty card, discards the completed mission along with the required shinies, and draws a new mission.

This process is repeated until 10 missions have been completed collectively, ending the game.

When the game ends players discard any remaining missions, shinies, or catchies they have then reveal their bounty cards and add up their values.  The player with the highest treasure value wins the game!

You'll need to manage your hand of catchies wisely while consistently making the right plays to hinder your opponent and advance yourself to ensure victory in this unpredictable contest because it's not a game of chance!

-description from designer

Name: Eleições 20XX
Description:
Eleições 20XX is about a fictional election in a fictional place. There are voter cards on the table, which show one or two preferences. Players use whatever it takes to make sure that voters who'd never vote for them anyway won't participate in the election, while those who might, vote for the right thing. 
The player who gets the most votes at election time wins.

Name: Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político
Description: Vossa Excelência: O Jogo Político (Your Excellency: The Political Game) is a card game about dirty politics. Players are elected office holders and have four years to consolidate their power to ensure re-election. They have to abuse their power to get enough votes and silence the opposition.

Name: Uga-Uga Bufapum
Description:
In prehistoric times, players strive to become the leader of their clan by being the most skillful farter, which they achieve when everyone else has passed out from the smells.

Uga-Uga Bufapum is a "take that" card game in which you play cards that either affect specific other players or the whole village. Players also might get the chance to eat meals to improve their farting abilities. The effect of each card is noted on it; aside from a "draw 2, play 2" rule, there seem to be few other rules in the game.

Name: Tá na Mesa
Description: Tá na Mesa is a game about a cooking contest between famous chefs who must prepare traditional dishes. To prepare a dish, one must collect the required ingredient cards, then combine dishes to achieve the best presentation in order to win the game.

Name: La 11 Coffee & Tea Party
Description:
In the café La Once, there is a special activity each year in which the guests must play about their food. Only those who play out the finals will be served the tastiest food in a special room. The (fictional) café has now decided to publish the game that is played.

In La 11 Coffee & Tea Party, players have to collect sets of the same cards to grab the sweet dishes on the table. For two of the same card, one may take the corresponding dish from the center of the table; for three of the same, one may steal it from another player. When a player has collected the three dishes in their secret mission card, that player wins. Special cards spice up the game flow.

Rather than being packaged in a box, the game comes in a cookie bag.

Name: Pop Rocket
Description: In Pop Rocket, you place the rocket in the middle of the playing area, pull the fuse, then wait for the rocket to pop! Quickly place your colored bowls around the rocket. As soon as the rocket opens, a colorful shower of stars flies through the air! Catch the most stars when the rocket pops to win!

Name: Kwirky
Description:
Kwirky is a fast-moving, quick-thinking, question-and-answer, bluff-and-banter game for family and friends., and in this game you decide the answers!

Answer against the clock, even if you don't know, by convincing others you do! Beware because players may call your bluff! Younger players compete on equal terms since quick wit and cheeky confidence are what you need in this game where all the answers are up for grabs.

Name: Penny Assassin
Description:
Penny Assassin is a dice chucking assassination game for 1-4 players.

Run across rooftops, hide from guards, look for the perfect shot, and then slay the targets. The enemy guards are constantly on the move, so the players must look for the opportune passage to strike.

In Penny Assassin, you start as a lowly member of a gang. As you travel about the town of Rorcester, you get stronger and more powerful. Missions that took multiple turns in the beginning can be accomplished in a flash, at the end. This leads to a mad dash to the finish. Only one can become The Most Awesome Assassin.

1-4 players get 3 actions each, per turn. Players can move unlimited spaces around the board, until they need to perform an action, such as hiding, climbing, or shooting. Events bring new missions and orders for the guards and coppers. Completing missions brings nickels. Nickels and pennies gained can be used to move closer towards victory, or for gaining more power and better tools of the trade. This brings the battle of risk versus reward, as players vie for the best strategy to take down the targets.

Different characters, skills, abilities, weapons, and setups give lots of options to take down the many targets.

Can you become the Most Awesome Assassin?

—description from the publisher

Name: Kids Know Best
Description:
The kids vs grown-ups trivia game where the grown-ups assume to know more than the kids, but is this true?

Kids team up and challenge the grown-ups as to what they know about kids' things. The grown-ups get to test how smart the kids are. The team that gets to the other side of the board first wins and knows best! Sounds easy - but be aware of the special spaces that may help you forward more quickly… or set you back!

—description from the publisher

Name: Tanks: Semovente
Description:
Although initially intended as a close-support artillery piece, the fact that the Semovente carried a bigger gun than the tanks it supported led to its use as a tank-destroyer, and then as a tank in its own right. By the time of the Tunisian fighting, the Semovente made up approximately half of the Italian armoured force in theatre, giving them significantly greater punch than in earlier battles in the desert.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Semovente tank
1x Semovente tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
4x Upgrade cards

Name: Tanks: M14/41
Description:
The 14 tonne M14/41 tank of 1941 was an upgrade of the older 13/40, featuring a more powerful engine fitted with sand filters. Despite its armour and armament remaining somewhat inadequate, the crew manning these tanks did their duty and fought bravely against any odds.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled M14/41 tank
1x M14/41 tank card
1x Hero card
3x Crew cards
3x Upgrade cards

Name: Tanks: Sherman II
Description:
The new Sherman tank was the next evolutionary step from the powerful Grant tank. Its large turret allowed it to mount an even more powerful 75mm gun in the turret rather than the hull front, and with thicker armour. Supplied to the British in large numbers the American built Sherman tank would fight through North Africa and Europe till the end of the war.

This pack contains:
1x unassembled Sherman II tank
1x Sherman II tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Tanks: Priest (RHA) – Tank Expansion
Description:
The RHA (Royal Horse Artillery) were highly experienced gunners. On the mobile battlefields of World War II they traded in their horse and limbers for American M7 self-propelled 105mm, nicknamed ‘Priest’ in British service. The Priest gave the armoured divisions a mobile artillery piece able to keep up with its tanks during cross-country moves.

This pack contains:
1x Unassembled Priest (RHA) tank
1x Priest (RHA) tank card
1x Hero card
2x Crew cards
2x Upgrade cards

Name: Nerd Battles
Description:
Nerd Battles is a card game for 2-4 players where nerds of all kinds fight for victory. Each nerd card has a base attack, defense, and IQ.  Extra attack and defense cards can be added to a nerd in battle, where their IQ value is the amount of extra cards they can add.  A nerd's attack and defense values can also be boosted by adding a confidence token.  Defeat 4 nerds and you win!

Everyone starts the game with 2 nerd cards, 4 battle cards, and 4 random confidence tokens.  At the start of a turn, draw 1 nerd card, or 2 battle cards. Then choose to pit your nerd against an opponents' to start a battle, or simply play an action card.  If you start a nerd battle, choose the player you want to attack, and put your nerd into play.  Add battle cards to your nerd to increase their attack defense, keeping the number of cards at or under their IQ value.  At this time, a confidence token can also be added to the nerd.  If the token matches the nerd, they get a permanent +2 to attack and defense.  If it's unmatching, it's only a +1 to those values, and is discarded at the end of the battle.

Then, the opponent needs to put a nerd into play to defend the attack.  If they can successfully block the attack by getting enough defense to equal or be greater than the attack, they not only don't lose, but they may be able to add enough attack cards to counter attack and defeat the attacking nerd.  They are still limited by the nerds IQ, but can also add a confidence token.  Either way, the losing nerd hides in the winners basement (an area under the play area) and gets turned sideways.  After the battle, all battle cards are discarded, but any nerds that didn't lose stay in play, face up.  Discard down to 7 battle cards, and it's the next player's turn. First player to get 4 nerds in their basement wins!

-description from designer

Name: Hero Team Quest
Description:
Hero Team Quest is a co-op game designed for young children.  Very few board games that kids are exposed to emphasize cooperation and team success.  With Hero Team Quest, all the players compete together and the outcome of victory or defeat is shared by all players.  The goal is to defeat the wizard before time runs out (when the goblin gives the crystal of magic to him).  The goblin moves 2 spaces on the board every round, closer to the end.  Players must get to the end and defeat the wizard before he gets there.

Players first form a hero team of four characters and each may obtain a magic power at the magic school - each power is a weakness of one of the four bosses in the game.  As they move across the board, they look to avoid losing a turn by stepping in mud.  Players stop on the battle spaces to roll the dice to defeat the various bosses.  Certain powers will make the chance of success better for some characters.  If you should lose, you go to the cage where you must roll a 1 on your turn to pick the lock.  Otherwise, other players may come to your rescue if they should defeat the boss OR they can decide to continue on the path if time is of the essence.

The game does offer some choices and teamwork/communication, but is ultimately a simple game designed for young kids that is easy to follow.  From a complexity standpoint, it's a step up from games such as Candyland, Chutes and Ladders, Sorry, etc. - but in a genre that most kids enjoy.

—description from the publisher

Name: The Lepak Game: Expansion Pack 1.0
Description:
Malaysianised card game based on the same engine as Cards against Humanity.

START
Choose a ‘Boss’ (the judge)
Boss deals all players 8 cards

MATCH
Boss displays and reads aloud a Yellow card
All players (except the Boss) match a Blue card within their hand to the Yellow card

BODEK
Players bodek (flatter) the Boss to choose their card
Boss picks a winner

Expansion 1.0 contains:

100 fresh new cards
Instruction sheet
New Blue Cards
New Fill-in-the-blank Yellow Cards
New Power Cards
A few completely blank cards for you to create your own content

Name: Byczyna 1588
Description:
Game covers battle at Byczyna, fought 24 January 1588 near Byczyna at Silesa. It was the deciding battle of the 1587–1588 War of the Polish Succession, which erupted after two rival candidates were elected to the Polish throne.
Game uses Husaria system.

Name: Unlock!: Exotic Adventures
Description:
Unlock! Exotic Adventures features three new "escape room" scenarios that you can play on your tabletop.

Unlock! is a cooperative card game inspired by escape rooms that uses a simple system which allows you to search scenes, combine objects, and solve riddles. Play Unlock! to embark on great adventures, while seated at a table using only cards and a companion app that can provide clues, check codes, monitor time remaining, etc. The three scenarios are:

- Night of the Boogeymen
 - Scheherazade's Last Tale
 - Expedition: Challenger

Name: Pixel Glory: Light & Shadow – Heroic Dungeon
Description:
An co-op expansion for Pixel Glory: Light and Shadow that pits you against every monster from the base game and Light and Shadow in 2 stages. Some monsters have the keyword "Loot" which gives you an item to help you and your friends survive.

Comes with:
51 foiled monster cards
5 foiled loot cards

Name: Nova Aetas: Under Siege
Description:
This awe-inspiring second expansion will catapult you into the midst of the conflict between Emperor Charles V and Pope Clement VII of Rome.

The Lansquenet troops led by General Georg Von Frundsberg cross through Italy to punish the Pope and take over the eternal city, and only one person dares to stand in their way... Captain Giovanni dalle Bande Nere with his free company.

Will you join forces with him in a desperate attempt to save Rome? Or will you join the siege, uniting with the Emperor's troops? The choice is yours, but once again, history is in your hands!

Nova Aetas Under Siege includes 10 new missions and a new hero class: the Lancer; two new groups: the Lansquenets and the Black Bands led by their charismatic captains (13 miniatures in total).; a new scenic element: the church, and everything else needed to dive into this desperate and overwhelming series of adventures!

Name: Nova Aetas: Duel Pack – Renzo vs Diletto
Description:
It contains a scenario and rules on how to play Renzo and Diletto, both as enemies and allies, together with the two epic miniatures representing them.

Contents:
1 Renzo miniature
1 Diletto miniature
4 enemy cards
2 tokens
2 missions

Name: Nova Aetas: Duel Pack – Pope vs Doge
Description:
Doge Vs Pope: this box contains a scenario and rules on how to play the Pope and Doge, both as enemies and allies, together with the two fantastic miniatures representing them.

Contents:
1 Pope miniature
1 Doge miniature
4 enemy cards
2 tokens
2 missions

Name: Nova Aetas: Mater Ignis
Description: This ArtBox contains the hunter, a new hero, and his nemesis, Mater Ignis, a fire-starting Salamander that terrorized the towns of Renaissance Italy. In this box, in addition to the 2 main characters, you'll also find 5 salamanders and the miniature Kickstarter exclusive, Salimero, a baby salamander that can be won through an associated hunt mission.

Name: Nova Aetas: Draco
Description:
This includes a miniature, hunt missions, and the required cards to add this new enemy and new epic equipment for the heroes to the game.

Contents:
1 monster size miniature
1 hunting side mission
tokens

Name: Nova Aetas: Manticore
Description:
This includes a miniature, hunt missions, and the required cards to add this new enemy and new epic equipment for the heroes to the game.

Contents:
1 monster size miniature
2 prey cards
17 prey action cards
1 hunting side mission
tokens

Name: Nova Aetas: Pets
Description: This is a package containing 4 pets that you can collect by playing the adventures in Nova Aetas and Vesuvio's Forge!

Name: Nova Aetas: Architect
Description:
This hero will be your preferred if you love to modify the battlefield and surprise your enemies with genial inventions. Even the 2 specializations use special equipment like Meccano or Artifacts.

The Architect's equipment is a mix of technological inventions just created and antique objects lost in time and recovered from a far past!

The Antiquarian can use powerful Artifacts during a battle. These incredible relics are randomly picked from his bag and used once per mission.

Name: Nova Aetas: Pandora’s Box
Description:
Welcome to Pandora’s Box, unlike it’s mythical counterpart, in this box you will find all the marvels unlocked during the Nova Aetas Kickstarter campaign. This rich box is an expression of Ludus Magnus Studios’ gratitude toward all the supporters that believed in our first project.

This box adds 1 new hero, the Cabalist, and epic classes to evolve each of your heroes even further. In addition, there are 5 Persona that you can meet in secondary missions throughout your adventures, depending on the outcome of these missions the persona will either join your Free Company as you go about your adventures or they will come back to face off against you. There are also 18 enemy miniatures that create the 8 new types of enemies you may encounter in the world of Nova Aetas.

All of this, along with new scenic elements, new missions, more pets, and much more adds replay-ability and versatility to the World of Nova Aetas.
